text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm a with ham and potato soup i know
we just did a hearty black bean soup not
too long ago but it's chilly around here
and i had a piece of leftover ham i
wanted to use and this is one of my
favorite favorite soups of all time so i
wanted to share it this soup starts like
most soups start out with dicing some
vegetables the size really doesn't
matter that much it's nice if they're
all about the same which mine are
alright so i diced my veggies up and
there's my piece of leftover ham i did
about the same size dice alright once
that's done I'm going to put a soup pot
on the stove over medium heat with a
chunk of butter and as soon as it melts
and turns a light golden color I'm going
to throw in my vegetables in ham and I'm
also going to throw in some sliced
garlic that's right we don't always have
to mince it sometimes we go Goodfellows
on that stuff I'm going to sweat the
vegetables in the ham in that butter for
about I don't know 5 6 minutes until the
vegetables start to soften the onions
will get sort of translucent at that
point I'm going to add some flour and
who just said that's a roux that's right
it is a roux and by the way stop showing
off nobody likes to know it all all
right so we're still on medium heat here
we're going to cook the flour in the fat
and the vegetables for about 3 minutes
at that point I'm going to drizzle in a
quart of cold chicken broth you know the
mantra repeat after me
hot rue cold stock no lumps all right so
we start off a little slow splash it in
stirred around splash some more in stir
it around and at that point you could
just dump it all in the flour is so well
dispersed on the surfaces of all that
diced vegetable that it's really not
going to lump up anyway so don't worry
too much I'm also going to add a couple
cups of water give it a stir we're going
to raise the heat up to medium-high and
bring it up to a simmer and we're simply
going to simmer that for about 15
minutes while I prep my potatoes now I'm
using Yukon Gold you can use any potato
you want but Yukon Gold have a very nice
texture for this I'm going to cut those
in thick slices then in sticks and then
across to cube it now I didn't measure
these you know because I'm not insane
but
probably about a quarter-inch
approximately as long as they're
generally the same size nobody really
cares how big your cubes are except
maybe Picasso but he's dead that one
goes out to all you art majors by the
way how do you get an art major off your
doorstep pay for the pizza
okay the potatoes diced I'm going to
keep that in cold water until needed my
soup has been simmering for about 15
minutes but before I add the potatoes
taste for salt depending on how salty
your ham is you may or may not need to
add more salt okay I don't want to put
the potatoes in a bland broth there
should be some salt in the broth as the
potatoes cook all right so I just did
mine with some salt I dumped in the
potatoes and we're going to cook that
for about 15 minutes if you want to
while the potatoes are cooking you could
skim that butter off the top but I like
to just stir it in to the final product
at the end when it's thick it's butter
why waste it all right you know your
potatoes are ready when they are
smashable so grab a few potatoes with a
ladle and if you can mush him like that
it's ready so the roux we made earlier
thickened it somewhat but I want to have
a little more body all right a little
more thickness a little heavier
viscosity so I'm going to take a potato
masher and just give it I don't know
eight or nine or ten or twelve smashes
with that that's going to release some
potato starch into the soup and thicken
it a little more and the more you do it
the thicker it would be but I do want
lots of chunks of potato okay
ham and potato soup has chunks of ham
and potato unless you're doing like
cream of potato soup which is a puree
you want to leave some chunks so that's
just about perfect ready for the final
stage seasoning cayenne raise your hand
if you're surprised some black pepper
you're definitely going to taste and
adjust for salt mine was perfect and
then just a little splash of cream just
because give it a stir and as soon as
that cream is heated through which takes
just seconds you're ready to serve what
a gorgeous gorgeous soup really really
loved this cold winter day just nothing
better so we're going to ladle that up I
garnish with some fresh chives because I
you know have them in the backyard but
that's optional and that's it
and this
just tasted so good smoky ham creamy
comforting potatoes the aromatic
vegetables a little bit of spice just a
beautiful beautiful soup experience this
is awesome made ahead so don't be afraid
to make this ahead of time you can even
freeze it and reheat it when you want
anyway go check out food whooshes calm
for all the ingredient amounts as usual
and as always enjoy
